Navigations-Links überspringen
  • Überblick
  • Package
  • Klasse
  • Baum
  • Veraltet
  • Index
  • Hilfe
SEARCH

Alle Klassen und Schnittstellen

Klasse
Beschreibung
CommandReward
This is a reward that executes a command when it is applied.
You can get the data using CommandReward.createMilestone(String, boolean, SenderType, Component, int) or CommandReward.createMilestone(String, boolean, SenderType, Component, int).
CommandReward.Creator
Creates a new CommandReward from config.
CommandReward.SenderType
The sender type of the command.
Either the player itself or the console.
Support for custom command senders is planned.
Formatters
Contains message format utilities.
IntervalReward
Represents an interval reward.
Interval rewards are applied each n levels.
IntervalRewardData
The data for an interval reward.
This data is normally created by the reward creator for the specific reward type, like CommandReward.createInterval(String, boolean, CommandReward.SenderType, Component, int, int, int).
It can be used to create events using RewardsManager.addIntervalReward(RewardConfig, IntervalRewardData).
Leveler
A leveling player.
Each player has a leveler, which handles the leveling for that player.
Leveler.SyncResult
The result of the database sync.
LevelerData
Represents the data of a player.
It is not recommended to change values from inside upgrades.
LevelingManager
Manages the Levelers.
LevelUpEvent
An event that is fired when a player levels up.
LuckPermsPermissionReward
A reward that gives a permission to a player when it is applied.
It also checks if the permission is still applied, even when the reward is already applied.
If the permission has been removed, it is re-applied.
LuckPermsPermissionReward.Creator
Creates a new LuckPermsPermissionReward from config.
MilestoneReward
Represents a milestone reward.
This reward is applied once when the player reaches level x.
It can also check if the reward is no longer applied and then re-apply it using the RewardCondition.
MilestoneRewardData
The data of a milestone reward.
This data is normally created by the reward creator for the specific reward type, like CommandReward.createMilestone(String, boolean, CommandReward.SenderType, Component, int).
It can be used to create events using RewardsManager.addMilestoneReward(RewardConfig, MilestoneRewardData).
PlayerLevelsAPI
The main API interface of the PlayerLevels plugin.
PlayerLevelsAPIProvider
Class for getting the api.
PlayerPointsReward
This is a reward that give a player a specific amount of points when applied.
You can get the data using PlayerPointsReward.createMilestone(String, String, int) or PlayerPointsReward.createInterval(String, String, int, int, int).
The reward uses a formula which has the variables level and xp.
PlayerPointsReward.Creator
Creates a new PlayerPointsReward from config.
ReceivedReward
Represents a reward a player has received.
This is an entry that the plugin knows the player has already received the reward, and not the reward itself.
If you are looking for the actual reward, go to Reward.
Reward
A reward a player will receive for reaching a specific level.
RewardAppliedEvent
This event is fired after the reward has been marked as applied.
RewardApplyEvent
This event is fired when a reward is applied.
The result of this event will control if the event is applied and/or marked as applied.
RewardApplyEvent.Result
The event result.
RewardCondition
A condition when a reward is already applied, which is additional to the level condition integrated in the reward itself.
This can be used for example to do a permission check for a permission reward.
RewardConfig
The configuration for creating a reward.
RewardCreator
Creates reward data from config.
RewardDescriptionProvider
Provides a description for a reward.
This is used instead of a static value to allow the reward to display dynamic information.
RewardExecutor
This contains the code which is executed when a reward is applied.
RewardsManager
Manages rewards.
RewardsRegistry
Contains RewardCreators for creating rewards using the config.
TagResolvers
Contains TagResolvers for the MiniMessage format.
TagResolvers.RewardContext
Contains information about a leveler for the reward tag resolvers.
TopListManager
Manages the top list.
TopListManager.TopListEntry
A top list entry.
